channel.title: SCAR on Wikipedia!?
channel.description:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scar_runescape
It seems that Scar is on Wikipedia. Should we edit it to make it better? Or request to delete it? Kaitnieks.com link is there, but Moparistehbest.com isn't. That's good. :)
Also Moparisthebest.com errors are insane now. I have to refresh the page almost 3 times just to get to login and another 4 times to be able to make this topic. Let's hope I can post this.
Look at Jagex on wikipedia. [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jagex#No_Contact_Information]Jagex Wiki[/url] - Look at the no contact info.
~Ron
PS: I made it in case you didn't get the sarcasm above. :rolleyes:

item.description:
@Ron wrote:

-CJT-:

I added a whole cheating section to the Runescape wikipedia thing, but they took it off and told me “Don’t post rubbish like you did on the Runescape page” and blocked me from editing for a month.

Oh that’s a shame man. Sometimes the people who manage wikipedia act like real bastards.

item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

How to: stick up for the scar wikepdia entry

Goto this page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion/Scar_runescape

Click edit on the right and append *'''Don't Delete''' Scar exists and is going strong.

item.title: SCAR on Wikipedia!?

item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Aftermath_96, post:20, topic:4160”]Kaitnieks - Founder of SCAR, is dead, and leading a far greater life of happiness.
What the fuck!?
Kaitnieks isn’t dead, and the ‘leading a far greater life of happiness’ sounds like a goddamn eulogy.[/quote]
Who wrote that… Why do people think he’s dead??? Mopar should post something in the News fader thing saying that Kaitnieks isn’t dead.

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR on Wikipedia!?
item.dc:creator: @philodespotos philodespotos
item.description:
@philodespotos wrote:

It was prod’d already by an RC patroller.

Good luck, guys.

Wtf? Why? Playing superman? Dedicated? lol
Because WP is supposed to be a legitimate encyclopedia, not a place for you to dump your inside jokes and spew a bunch of names no average user would ever care about. Despite what most people seem to think, not just anything should be on Wikipedia.

Anyhow, the prod tag has already been added by another editor (I was at least going to give everyone a chance to make it decent). If you contest it, you can delete it from the main page and comment on the talk page as to why you think the page should stay. After that, the guy will most likely move it to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion and you can argue for it there.

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR on Wikipedia!?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Yeah lol.

Starblaster, you put it on? I thought we need to keep Mopar secret.

phil

Ron:

I tried to make it funny lol.

read the posts. And in the first post I was being sarcastic.

Oh and…

I'm going to propose it for deletion in the next day or two.
Wtf? Why? Playing superman? Dedicated? lol

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR on Wikipedia!?
item.dc:creator: @philodespotos philodespotos
item.description:
@philodespotos wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:1, topic:4160”]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scar_runescape

It seems that Scar is on Wikipedia. Should we edit it to make it better? Or request to delete it? Kaitnieks.com link is there, but Moparistehbest.com isn’t. That’s good. :)[/quote]
I find this odd, coming from you, as user “RonTheCon” created the article yesterday. I’m assuming that’s not a coincidence.

This is just fair warning that Runescapecruft gets deleted rapidly and with extreme prejudice on Wikipedia, as it tends to all be utterly useless crap. As a semi-active editor, unless this very magically gets cleaned up and receives actual content, I’m going to propose it for deletion in the next day or two.

Basic policies/guidelines for Wikipedia which you should bear in mind:

en.wikipedia.org

Wikipedia:Proposed deletion

Proposed deletion (PROD) is a way to suggest an article or file for uncontroversial deletion. It is an easier method of removing articles or files than the articles for deletion (AfD) or files for discussion (FfD) processes, and is meant for uncomplicated deletion proposals that do not meet the strict criteria for speedy deletion. PROD must only be used if no opposition to the deletion is expected. It must never be used simultaneously with a deletion discussion (AfD or FfD), and it may only be...


en.wikipedia.org

Wikipedia:Notability

On Wikipedia, notability is a test used by editors to decide whether a given topic warrants its own article. Information on Wikipedia must be verifiable; if no reliable third-party sources can be found on a topic, then it should not have a separate article. Wikipedia's concept of notability applies this basic standard to avoid indiscriminate inclusion of topics. Article and list topics must be notable, or "worthy of notice". Determining notability does not necessarily depend on things such...


en.wikipedia.org

Wikipedia:Spam

There are three main types of spam on Wikipedia. These are: advertisements masquerading as articles and contributions to articles; external link spamming; and adding references with the aim of promoting the author or the work being referenced. Articles considered advertisements include those that are solicitations for a business, product or service, or are public relations pieces designed to promote a company or individual. Wikispam articles are usually noted for sales-oriented language and ex...

Specifically the second link: you have to assert some sort of notability of SCAR. It may be notable to us, but why would the average WP user really care?

Also: if you want this page not to be deleted and protected from recreation, I would advise everyone who touches it not to deface the Runescape or Jagex articles, and not to link to it from the main Runescape article, or create a “Cheating” section or whathaveyou. It’s only going to make the deletion process move that much more quickly.

Please do not spam this page with constant edits, or keep reverting each other by adding then removing the link to these forums. Lots of people monitor the Recent changes list and will go out of their way to delete this article ASAP. I’d really kind of like to see SCAR stay on Wikipedia, but there’s a standard of quality it has to meet first. (Also: someone may want to move it to [[SCAR]])

pd.

Read full topic
